subject: Mental Health
title: Teenage Anxiety Surge
description: Learn Teenage Anxiety Surge in one minute.

hook.text: Anxiety disorders spike in adolescence, with rates nearly tripling by age 18.

buildup.text: The teenage brain is rewiring itself, making emotions more intense and volatile.

discovery.text: The prefrontal cortex, which calms fear, doesn't mature until the mid-twenties.

twist.text: Social pressure, academic stress, and identity crises hit an unfinished brain.

climax.text: Teens who develop anxiety are far more likely to have depression as adults.

punchline.text: Big emotions in an unfinished brain are a perfect storm.

quiz.question: When does the prefrontal cortex fully mature?
